items.details:
MAP TESTING

Great job finishing your first MAP test in Science! The next test will be Reading  TOMORROW

The best way to get ready is to practice reading every day. Here are some ideas:

1) Read a mix of stories and informational texts
2) Ask yourself questions as you read, like “What happened first?” or “What is the main idea?”
3) Look for new words and try to figure out their meaning from the sentence
4) Retell the story or explain what you learned in your own words
5) Read out loud to practice fluency
6) Practice finding details that support the main idea

Upcoming  Class Tests!
Wednesday, September 24th - Math - Topic 3
Monday, September 29th - Social Studies - Topic 1

Reading 

Complete this week's definitions paper (DUE WEDNESDAY)

The story next week is 'Living in Deserts'. Please watch the video until you understand the story.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NxDlziHeNdg 

The spelling words for next week are from Vocabulary Workshop Units 3 and 4.

bargain

loyal
resource

vary
wander
capture
coward

gloomy

passage
restless
shallow
shatter
talent

I have assigned a story on What Lives in the Deserts? (DUE FRIDAY)

Please complete BEFORE NEXT FRIDAY!  Please answer every question and SUBMIT.

 Go to www.readworks.org/student 

Enter our class code YU6GQ2
Your password is 1234 unless you already changed it

Math

Tomorrow is the Topic 3 Math test. Please read over your math book and be ready to take the test.

Please have your child practice a little Khan Academy math each night at https://www.khanacademy.org/join/VK6QDS9E to help strengthen their skills.

THIS WILL HELP YOU WITH YOUR MATH MAP TEST

Korean 

Pages 115-119 and 20-33 in the Korean textbook and activity book.

Chinese

You need to write the words' student/boy/girl' twice before the next class.

Social Studies Group Project

Tomorrow is the presentation

If you need to share slides with me, please share them with my email

barrysmithmca@gmail.com

Land and Water -  Stella / Jenny / Jiwoo
Weather, Climate and Forces of Nature - Siwoo / Ian Choi / Jason
Using Earth’s Resources - Jey / Noah / Alex
Interacting with the Environment -  Woojoo / Yujoo / Ian Sa

Each group has three students. You need to read your chapter in the book and summarize the important information. Then you will reteach your lesson to the class.

You must do three things. A Google Slides or PowerPoint presentation that is bright and clear. An A3 poster that is colorful and eye-catching. A quiz that is fun and gets the class involved. The quiz could be an X and O quiz, a fill-in-the-gap quiz, or something online.

Each person in the group should take one job. One person makes the slides. One person makes the poster. One person makes the quiz.

Your goal is to make your classmates learn from you in a fun and creative way. You will present this on Wednesday, September 24th, the lesson before the social studies test.

ReadWorks Assignment 5/6 – Tropical Rainforests / Natural Resources (8 stories)

I have assigned a story on Rainforest and 8 stories about natural disasters on ReadWorks. Please complete it within the next 2 weeks.

 Go to www.readworks.org/student 

Enter our class code YU6GQ2
Your password is 1234 unless you already changed it
